summary.content:
Today's selection covers 76 articles from 8 trusted sources, including 49 on Artificial Intelligence and 13 on Fraud/Cybersecurity.

• **AI Spotlight**: Google’s AI search results will make links more obvious
• **Companies in Focus**: Coverage includes developments from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic
• **Security Alert**: Supply Chain Attack Embeds Malware in Android Devices
• **Threat Landscape**: Today's coverage highlights ransomware, data breaches, malware
• **Source Diversity**: Articles sourced from Dark Reading, The Verge, BBC Technology, TechCrunch, SecurityWeek and others
• **Fresh Content**: 47 articles published in the last 24 hours

top.title: Supply Chain Attack Embeds Malware in Android Devices
top.description: Keenadu downloads payloads that hijack browser searches, commit ad fraud, and execute other actions without user knowledge.

top.title: Google’s AI search results will make links more obvious
top.description: Google says it will now display links more prominently inside its AI-powered features in Search. Robby Stein, the vice president of Google Search, announced on Tuesday that a list of links will now ap...

top.title: Google announces dates for I/O 2026
top.description: It's official: Google I/O 2026 will take place from May 19th to 20th. In an announcement on Tuesday, Google says it will share the "latest AI breakthroughs and updates in products across the company,...

top.title: Could Bill Gates and political tussles overshadow AI safety debate in Delhi?
top.description: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

top.title: As AI jitters rattle IT stocks, Infosys partners with Anthropic to build ‘enterprise-grade’ AI agents
top.description: Under the partnership, Infosys plans to integrate Anthropic's Claude models into its Topaz AI platform to build so-called "agentic" systems.

top.title: Man Linked to Phobos Ransomware Arrested in Poland
top.description:
Polish police said they found evidence of cybercrime on the 47-year-old suspect’s devices.
The post Man Linked to Phobos Ransomware Arrested in Poland appeared first on SecurityWeek.

more.title: Samsung is slopping AI ads all over its social channels
more.description:
Even if the AI wasn’t being disclosed, its usage in these videos isn’t exactly subtle. | Image: Samsung / The Verge	

After cramming AI into every inch of its smartphones, appliances, and other device...

more.title: Running AI models is turning into a memory game
more.description: When we talk about the cost of AI infrastructure, the focus is usually on Nvidia and GPUs -- but memory is an increasingly important part of the picture.

more.title: Chinese hackers exploiting Dell zero-day flaw since mid-2024
more.description: A suspected Chinese state-backed hacking group has been quietly exploiting a critical Dell security flaw in zero-day attacks that started in mid-2024. [...]

more.title: Laurie Spiegel on the difference between algorithmic music and ‘AI’
more.description:
From Bell Labs to Macs, Laurie Spiegel has pushed musical boundaries. | Image: Irina Prosser / Eventide	

In 1986, electronic music pioneer Laurie Spiegel created Music Mouse, a way for those with a M...

more.title: India bids to attract over $200B in AI infrastructure investment by 2028
more.description: India is ramping up shared AI compute, adding 20,000 GPUs as part of a broader push to attract global AI investment.

more.title: Poland Energy Survives Attack on Wind, Solar Infrastructure
more.description: Russia-aligned groups are probable culprits behind the wiper attacks against renewable energy farms, a manufacturer, and a heating and power plant.

more.title: RMM Abuse Explodes as Hackers Ditch Malware
more.description: Remote monitoring and management (RMM) software offers hackers multiple benefits, including stealth, persistence, and operational efficiency.

more.title: ClickFix Attacks Abuses DNS Lookup Command to Deliver ModeloRAT
more.description: ClickFix campaigns have adapted to the latest defenses with a new technique to trick users into infecting their own machines with malware.

more.title: Apple is reportedly planning to launch AI-powered glasses, a pendant, and AirPods
more.description:
The second-gen Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses. | Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge	

Apple is pushing ahead with plans to launch its first pair of smart glasses, along with an AI-powered pendant...

more.title: WordPress’ new AI assistant will let users edit their sites with prompts
more.description: Starting on Tuesday, WordPress users can edit their websites using the new AI assistant built into the platform's site editor and media library, TechCrunch reports. The AI has a sidebar in the WordPre...

more.title: Let’s talk about Ring, lost dogs, and the surveillance state
more.description:
Today, let’s talk about the camera company Ring, lost dogs, and the surveillance state. 
You probably saw this ad during the Super Bowl a couple of weekends ago:

Since it aired for a massive audience...

more.title: Spain orders NordVPN, ProtonVPN to block LaLiga piracy sites
more.description: A Spanish court has granted precautionary measures against NordVPN and ProtonVPN, ordering the two popular VPN providers to block 16 websites that facilitate piracy of football matches. [...]

more.title: Notepad++ boosts update security with ‘double-lock’ mechanism
more.description: Notepad++ has adopted a "double-lock" design for its update mechanism to address recently exploited security gaps that resulted in a supply-chain compromise. [...]

more.title: With Niche Tech World References, Vibe Hopes Its Billboards Reach Start-Up Insiders
more.description: Billboards that wouldn’t make sense to people outside the tech industry have become common in the Bay Area. One company took the microtargeting game to another level.

more.title: Apple is reportedly cooking up a trio of AI wearables
more.description: As the AI hardware space heats up, the iPhone maker has multiple smart products in development.

more.title: New Keenadu backdoor found in Android firmware, Google Play apps
more.description: A newly discovered and sophisticated Android malware called Keenadu has been found embedded in firmware from multiple device brands, enabling it to compromise all installed applications and gain unres...

more.title: Anthropic releases Sonnet 4.6
more.description: Anthropic has released a new version of its midsized Sonnet model, keeping pace with the company's four-month update cycle.

more.title: Mistral AI buys Koyeb in first acquisition to back its cloud ambitions
more.description: Mistral AI has agreed to buy Koyeb, a Paris-based startup that simplifies AI app deployment at scale and manages the infrastructure behind it.

more.title: SpaceX vets raise $50M Series A for data center links
more.description: Mesh aims to mass-produce optical transceivers for AI data centers.

more.title: European Parliament blocks AI on lawmakers’ devices, citing security risks
more.description: EU lawmakers found their government-issued devices were blocked from using the baked-in AI tools, amid fears that sensitive information could turn up on the U.S. servers of AI companies.

more.title: WordPress.com adds an AI Assistant that can edit, adjust styles, create images, and more
more.description: The feature is designed to work inside the website to understand its content and layout, allowing site owners to make changes with natural language commands. The WordPress AI assistant doesn't need pr...

more.title: Here are the 17 US-based AI companies that have raised $100M or more in 2026
more.description: Three U.S.-based AI companies raised rounds larger than $1 billion so far in 2026, with 14 others raising rounds of $100 million or more.

more.title: Just 8 months in, India’s vibe-coding startup Emergent claims ARR of over $100M
more.description: Indian vibe-coding platform Emergent was launched just eight months ago, and it now says it's generating annual recurring revenue of more than $100 million, thanks to surging demand by small businesse...

more.title: SpendRule raises $2M, emerges from stealth to help hospitals track spending
more.description: SpendRule, launched last summer, is an AI-powered platform that helps healthcare systems track their spending.

more.title: Adani pledges $100B to build AI data centers as India seeks bigger role in the global AI race
more.description: Adani's plan targets up to 5 gigawatts of capacity, with data centers planned alongside partnerships with Google, Microsoft, and Flipkart.

more.description:
The latest funding round was led by Sorenson Capital and brings the total investment to $45 million.

more.description:
Eurail has confirmed that the stolen data is up for sale, but it’s still trying to determine how many individuals are impacted.

more.title: API Threats Grow in Scale as AI Expands the Blast Radius
more.description:
New research shows attackers increasingly abusing APIs at machine speed as AI-driven systems widen exposure and amplify impact.

more.description: Polish police have detained a 47-year-old man suspected of ties to the Phobos ransomware group and seized computers and mobile phones containing stolen credentials, credit card numbers, and server acc...

more.title: Ireland now also investigating X over Grok-made sexual images
more.description: Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC), the country's data protection authority, has opened a formal investigation into X over the use of the platform's Grok artificial intelligence tool to genera...

more.title: [Virtual Event] Shields Up: Key Technologies Reshaping Cybersecurity Defenses
We will do battle with AI chatbots as we did with Grok, says Starmer
more.description: The government's new plans will mean no online platform will get a "free pass" on children's safety on the internet, the prime minister says.

more.title: ByteDance to curb AI video app after Disney legal threat
more.description: Videos featuring Spider-Man and other characters which are Disney's intellectual property have gone viral since Seedance's update.

more.title: Reddit's human content wins amid the AI flood
more.description: Reddit says its human contributors are valued amid an internet awash with AI-generated content.

more.title: User Issues With X Appear to Have Resolved
more.description: The social media site was the subject of user complaints early Monday.

more.title: OpenClaw founder Peter Steinberger is joining OpenAI
more.description: Sam Altman announced on X that Peter Steinberger, the man behind the trendy AI agent OpenClaw, was joining OpenAI. He said that Steinberger has "a lot of amazing ideas" about getting AI agents to inte...

more.description: Vulnerabilities with high to critical severity ratings affecting popular Visual Studio Code (VSCode) extensions collectively downloaded more than 128 million times could be exploited to steal local fi...

more.title: Operation DoppelBrand: Weaponizing Fortune 500 Brands
more.description: The GS7 cyber-threat group targets US financial institutions with near-perfect imitations of corporate portals to steal credentials and gain remote access.

more.title: 260K+ Chrome Users Duped by Fake AI Browser Extensions
more.description: 30 copycat apps tricked users, and Google itself, into thinking they're legitimate AI tools.

more.title: After spooking Hollywood, ByteDance will tweak safeguards on new AI model
more.description:
Hollywood groups have spoken out against Seedance 2.0 since generated videos like fight scenes between Tom Cruise and Brad Pitt went viral. | Image by Dave Benett / WireImage via Getty	

TikTok creato...

more.title: Washington Hotel in Japan discloses ransomware infection incident
more.description: The Washington Hotel brand in Japan has announced that that its servers were compromised in a ransomware attack, exposing various business data. [...]

more.title: Eurail says stolen traveler data now up for sale on dark web
more.description: Eurail B.V., the operator that provides access to 250,000 kilometers of European railways, confirmed that data stolen in a breach earlier this year is being offered for sale on the dark web. [...]

more.title: Infostealer malware found stealing OpenClaw secrets for first time
more.description: With the massive adoption of the OpenClaw agentic AI assistant, information-stealing malware has been spotted stealing files associated with the framework that contain API keys, authentication tokens,...

more.title: Passwords to passkeys: Staying ISO 27001 compliant in a passwordless era
more.description: Password-based authentication is increasingly risky as organizations adopt passkeys to strengthen security and meet ISO/IEC 27001 requirements. Passwork explains how to align passwordless adoption wit...

more.title: CISA gives feds 3 days to patch actively exploited BeyondTrust flaw
more.description: CISA ordered U.S. government agencies on Friday to secure their BeyondTrust Remote Support instances against an actively exploited vulnerability within three days. [...]

more.title: How Ricursive Intelligence raised $335M at a $4B valuation in 4 months
more.description: The reason why this nascent startup had VCs lining up is the founders. They are so famed in the AI world, everyone tried to hire them.

more.title: Flapping Airplanes on the future of AI: ‘We want to try really radically different things’
more.description: "We're exploring a different set of trade-offs."

more.title: After all the hype, some AI experts don’t think OpenClaw is all that exciting
more.description: "From an AI research perspective, this is nothing novel," one expert told TechCrunch.

more.title: Fractal Analytics’ muted IPO debut signals persistent AI fears in India
more.description: As India's first AI company to IPO, Fractal Analytics didn't have a stellar first day on the public markets, as enthusiasm for the technology collided with jittery investors in the wake of a sell-off...

more.title: Dior, Louis Vuitton, Tiffany Fined $25 Million in South Korea After Data Breaches
more.description:
Luxury brands were among the dozens of major companies whose Salesforce instances were targeted by Scattered LAPSUS$ Hunters.
The post Dior, Louis Vuitton, Tiffany Fined $25 Million in South Korea Aft...

more.description:
Industrial cybersecurity firm Dragos has published its 9th Year in Review OT/ICS Cybersecurity Report.
The post 3 Threat Groups Started Targeting ICS/OT in 2025: Dragos  appeared first on SecurityWeek...

more.title: Password managers' promise that they can't see your vaults isn't always true
more.description: Contrary to what password managers say, a server compromise can mean game over.

more.title: Most VMware users still "actively reducing their VMware footprint," survey finds
more.description: Broadcom's "strategy was never to keep every customer," CloudBolt report says.

more.title: Chatbots Are the New Influencers Brands Must Woo
more.description: Companies are realizing they can no longer simply promote themselves to potential customers. They have to win over the robots, too.

more.title: Microsoft Teams outage affects users in United States, Europe
more.description: ​Microsoft is working to resolve an ongoing outage affecting Microsoft Teams users, causing delays and preventing some from accessing the service. [...]

more.title: What 5 Million Apps Revealed About Secrets in JavaScript
more.description: Leaked API keys are nothing new, but the scale of the problem in front-end code has been largely a mystery - until now. Intruder's research team built a new secrets detection method and scanned 5 mill...

more.title: Amazon Fire TV’s new interface is now rolling out in the US
more.description: Fire TV's new interface simplifies its layout and navigation and adds Alexa+.

more.title: Cohere launches a family of open multilingual models
more.description: Cohere's Tiny Aya models support over 70 langauges

more.title: Password Managers Vulnerable to Vault Compromise Under Malicious Server
more.description:
Researchers at ETH Zurich have tested the security of Bitwarden, LastPass, Dashlane, and 1Password password managers.
The post Password Managers Vulnerable to Vault Compromise Under Malicious Server a...

more.title: Could an Electronic Coach Help Ski Jumpers Leap Farther?
more.description: Future Olympic prospects are testing a device that can give them corrective advice in real time as they hurtle into the air.

more.title: How dark web agent spotted bedroom wall clue to rescue girl from years of harm
more.description: Detectives desperate to locate a 12-year-old, seen abused online, found a surprising lead.

more.title: New Silent Hill game inspired by tiny fishing village in Fife
more.description: Silent Hill: Townfall is set in the fictional St Amelia, based on the real village of St Monans in the East Neuk of Fife.

more.title: Their Secret to a Happy Marriage? A Translation App
more.description: He speaks English. She speaks Mandarin. The secret to their happy marriage: Microsoft Translator.

more.title: I hate my AI pet with every fiber of my being
more.description:
I can still hear it whining and whirring. | Photo by Robert Hart / The Verge	

After a few weeks living with Casio's AI-powered pet, Moflin, I finally understand why my mother hated my Furby so much....

more.title: Man arrested for demanding reward after accidental police data leak
more.description: Dutch authorities arrested a 40-year-old man after he downloaded confidential documents that had been mistakenly shared by the police and refused to delete them unless he received "something in return...

more.title: Have money, will travel: a16z’s hunt for the next European unicorn
more.description: According to a16z, it has eyes around the world in order to spot companies as early as local funds might.

more.title: Android 17 Beta Strengthens Secure-by-Default Design for Privacy and App Security
more.description:
The latest Android version continues to improve security and privacy, according to its developers.

more.title: CISA Navigates DHS Shutdown With Reduced Staff
more.description:
CISA is currently operating at roughly 38% capacity (888 out of 2,341 staff) due to the DHS shutdown that began February 14, 2026.
The post CISA Navigates DHS Shutdown With Reduced Staff appeared firs...

more.title: More Than Ever, Videos Expose the Truth. And Cloud It, Too.
more.description: In Minneapolis, videos of the Alex Pretti killing undermined the federal government’s account. But an A.I. video of Brad Pitt shows the dangers ahead.
